column4: hey, i'm trying to use a dynamic ip with a static DNS, but when ever i set it in network manager, it gets reset when i restart the firefox, does anyone know of a work around?
that didnt seem to come in correct, you were using a dynamic ip (doled out by dhcp?) and your dns is what?
never mind, google got me there
i'm at college, my ip is set by the school, i want to set it up so that opendns is my primary dns, and the school's dns server is the secondary

my /etc/resolv.conf is set to the school's dns servers, i've tried to change and save it to what i want, but when i restart the firefox, it works for one url, then defaults back to useing just the school dns\
i've done this before on a windows box, the set up behind it works, but right nwo ubuntu won't save the settings
its possible, because if your school blocks another dns, your client will time out and have to use the remaining name server on the list
the school does not block the other dns, i have done this on windows boxes, ubuntu just seems to over write the file, i've tried to make it read only, that didn't work
sorry, i've never used the paste bin, how does it work?
look at your /etc/dhcp3/dhclient.conf
http://paste.ubuntu.com/4649/
thanks, i've not found this yet
yep
perhaps remove the domain-name-servers from dhclient.conf, lets see if you can override
it looks like everything in the dhcpclient.conf is commented out except request
perhaps remove the domain-name-servers from dhclient.conf, lets see if you can override
so just remove the entry?
ok, i'll make a back up and try it
good idea to backup
you still there?
ok good, made it back to the web, do you know if ubuntu can hold more that 2 dns servers?
it seems to be working
thank you, good bye
you're welcome
